title: Common Configuration Settings
description: Common configuration settings for this deployment

nuage_unzipped_files_dir.title: Nuage Unzip Files Directory
nuage_unzipped_files_dir.description: Full path to the directory where the Nuage unzipped files for this deployment can be found  E.g. qcow2 files. When using docker container the path needs to be a relative path from the images path specified during setup.

nuage_software_version.title: Nuage Software Version
nuage_software_version.description: Nuage software version being installed. Optional for version comparison to skip deployment of some components that have already been installed.

images_path.title: KVM Images Directory
images_path.description: Full path to the directory on the KVM target server where qcow2 files will be copied

dns_domain.title: Domain Name
dns_domain.description: Domain name for this deployment. E.g. company.net.

metro_reports_dir.title: Reports Directory
metro_reports_dir.description: Full path to the directory where the generated health reports for this deployment will be placed

branding_zip_file.title: Branding Zip File
branding_zip_file.description: Enables custom branding for the VSD GUI. When not defined, the default VSD branding, already present on the VSD itself, will be used. If branding_zip_file is defined, its value will be used to replace the default VSD branding with the contents of a zip file on the Ansible host.  The files contained in the zip file should conform to the specifications of the VNS install guide. For replacing the default branding on the VSD, this value should be set to one of the following values: 1) The path to a branding zip file on the Ansible host 2) The special value 'nuage' for adding a MetroAE tag to the default VSD branding. This value is provided as an example of a minimal modification of branding. 3) The special value 'metroae' to replace the default VSD branding with a complete MetroAE-themed brand. This value is provided as an example of a complete replacement of all branding components. Note that when this is defined the existing branding will be backed up to the directory specified by the Metro Backup Root variable under (hostname)-branding/. To rollback a branding change, copy the branding zip file out of the backup directory, set this variable to the path to the copied backup file, and run the brand_vsd playbook, i.e. metroae brand_vsd.

vsd_fqdn_global.title: Global VSD FQDN
vsd_fqdn_global.description: For clustered VSD, the XMPP FQDN for the cluster; For standalone VSD, the FQDN of the single VSD

vsd_port_global.title: Global VSD API port
vsd_port_global.description: For clustered VSD, server port on the Proxy/LB endpoint; For standalone VSD, port on the standalone instance

portal_fqdn_global.title: Global SD-WAN Portal FQDN
portal_fqdn_global.description: For HA PORTAL, the FQDN for the Proxy/LB endpoint; For standalone PORTAL, the FQDN of the single PORTAL

vstat_fqdn_global.title: Global VSTAT FQDN
vstat_fqdn_global.description: For clustered VSTAT, the FQDN for the VSTAT cluster; For standalone VSTAT, the FQDN of the single VSTAT

mgmt_bridge.title: Management Network Bridge
mgmt_bridge.description: Network Bridge used for the management interface of a component or the BOF interface on VSC. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when deploying on KVM. This field can be overridden by defining the management network bridge separately in the component configuration

data_bridge.title: Data Network Bridge
data_bridge.description: Network Bridge used for the data path of a component or the Control interface on VSC. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when deploying on KVM. This field can be overridden by defining the Data network bridge separately in the component configuration

access_bridge.title: NSGv Access Bridge
access_bridge.description: Network bridge used for the access network when installing an NSGv. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when installing on KVM

ntp_server_list.title: NTP Server IP(s)
ntp_server_list.description: List of one or more NTP server addresses that must be in dotted-decimal (IPv4) or hexidecimal (IPv6) format

dns_server_list.title: DNS server IP(s)
dns_server_list.description: List of one or more DNS server addresses for resolving component domain names. Must be in dotted-decimal (IPv4) or hexidecimal (IPv6) format.

stats_out.title: Statistics Out Deployment
stats_out.description: Set the deployment for stats-out.  At this time, only exactly 3 clustered VSDs and exactly 3 stats VSDs are supported.  The first 3 VSDs specified are clustered and the remaining are marked statistics only

stats_out_proxy.title: Statistics Out Proxy Address
stats_out_proxy.description: Set the proxy address for a stats-out deployment.  If unspecified the first NUH to be deployed will be used as the proxy.  If there are no NUHs being deployed, an alternative proxy address must be specified.

skip_dns_resolution_tests.title: Skip DNS Resolution Tests
skip_dns_resolution_tests.description: When true, skip DNS resolution checks for hostnames from the MetroAE host. This is used for situations where the VSP components are configured to use a DNS server that is not accessible from the MetroAE host or when you are deploying a new DNS server with MetroAE.

vsd_run_cluster_rtt_test.title: Run VSD Cluster RTT Tests
vsd_run_cluster_rtt_test.description: When true, run RTT tests between VSDs in a cluster or standby/active cluster

vsd_ignore_errors_rtt_test.title: Ignore RTT Test Errors
vsd_ignore_errors_rtt_test.description: When true, continue MetroAE execution upon error and do not validate the RTT between VSDs in a cluster is less than max RTT, else stop MetroAE execution upon error

vsd_max_cluster_rtt_msec.title: Max VSD cluster RTT
vsd_max_cluster_rtt_msec.description: Maximum RTT in milliseconds between VSDs in a cluster

vsd_max_active_standby_rtt_msec.title: Max VSD active-standby RTT
vsd_max_active_standby_rtt_msec.description: Maximum RTT in milliseconds between Active and Standby VSDs

vsd_run_disk_performance_test.title: Run VSD Disk Performance Test
vsd_run_disk_performance_test.description: Run the VSD disk performance test when true, else skip the test

vsd_disk_performance_test_total_file_siz.title: Total Size of Disk Performance Test Files
vsd_disk_performance_test_total_file_siz.description: Sets the total size of created files for VSD disk performance test. For a valid measurement, the total file size must be larger than VSD RAM to minimize the effects of caching.

vsd_disk_performance_test_minimum_thresh.title: Minimum Disk Performance Threshold
vsd_disk_performance_test_minimum_thresh.description: Sets the minimum value for VSD disk performance test in IOPS

vsd_disk_performance_test_max_time.title: Duration of Disk Performance Test in Seconds
vsd_disk_performance_test_max_time.description: Sets the duration of the VSD disk performance test in seconds

vsd_ignore_disk_performance_test_errors.title: Ignore Disk Performance Test Errors
vsd_ignore_disk_performance_test_errors.description: When true, continue MetroAE execution upon error and ignore the results of the VSD disk performance test, else stop MetroAE execution upon error

prompt_before_destroy.title: Prompt before destroying components
prompt_before_destroy.description: When true, ask user for confirmation before MetroAE destroys components.

backup_directory_root.title: Backup directory
backup_directory_root.description: Specifies the global directory root to store backup file sets on the MetroAE host.  This overrides metro_backup_root in the upgrade deployment file if specified.  If neither is specified, a backups directory will be created off of nuage_unzipped_files_dir.

max_num_stored_backups.title: Maximum number of backups to store.
max_num_stored_backups.description: Specifies the maximum number of backups to store in backup_directory_root.  The oldest backups of the same type exceeding this amount will be deleted at backup time.  The default of -1 specifies no limit.

backup_to_restore.title: Backup set directory to be restored.
backup_to_restore.description: The name of the backup file set directory under the backup_directory_root to restore.

vcenter_datacenter.title: vCenter Datacenter
vcenter_datacenter.description: vCenter datacenter to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_cluster.title: vCenter Cluster Name
vcenter_cluster.description: Name of the vCenter cluster on which to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_host_reference.title: vCenter Host Reference
vcenter_host_reference.description: Requires ovftool 4.3. Reference to the host on the vCenter cluster on which to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_datastore.title: vCenter Datastore Name
vcenter_datastore.description: Name of the vCenter datastore on which to deploy the Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_vmfolder.title: vCenter VM Folder
vcenter_vmfolder.description: Optional path to a folder defined on vCenter where VM will be instantiated

vcenter_host_clusters_folder.title: vCenter Hosts and Clusters Folder
vcenter_host_clusters_folder.description: Optional path to a hosts and clusters folder defined on vCenter where VM will be instantiated

vcenter_resource_pool.title: vCenter Resource Pool
vcenter_resource_pool.description: The vCenter resource pool where the VMs need to be located. A resource pool is a logical abstraction of resources. Different resource pools can be configured to have different priorities in case of resource contention and can have different resource reservations and limitations.

vcenter_ovftool.title: OVF tool location
vcenter_ovftool.description: This is the full path to the vCenter OVFtool executable. When running metroae from a clone of the nuage-metroae repo, this should be set to the path to ovftool on the host, usually /usr/bin/ovftool. When running the metroae Docker container, the ovftool installation directory, /usr/lib/vmware-ovftool, must be copied to the metroae_data directory and this parameter must be set to the internal container path to the ovftool in that directory, /data/vmware-ovftool/ovftool.

vcenter_start_vsd_with_interfaces_disabl.title: vCenter Interfaces Disabled State
vcenter_start_vsd_with_interfaces_disabl.description: This when set to true starts the VM with disabled interfaces during upgrade process

openstack_project_domain_name.title: OpenStack Project Domain Name
openstack_project_domain_name.description: Project domain name for OpenStack if required

openstack_user_domain_name.title: OpenStack User Domain Name
openstack_user_domain_name.description: User domain name for OpenStack if required

openstack_cacert.title: OpenStack CA Certificate
openstack_cacert.description: CA cetrificate file path for Openstack if necessary

user_ssh_pub_key.title: SSH Public Key
user_ssh_pub_key.description: Full path to the public key file to be injected into Nuage components to enable passwordless connectivity for configuration. When using docker container changing the path from default can cause connectivity issues

xmpp_tls.title: XMPP TLS
xmpp_tls.description: Flag to indicate when secure communications via TLS will be used between VSCs and VSDs

xmpp_tls_mode.title: Set XMPP TLS mode require or allow
xmpp_tls_mode.description: Set XMPP TLS mode require or allow

openflow_tls.title: OpenFlow TLS
openflow_tls.description: Flag to indicate when secure communications via TLS will be used between VSCs and data plane components, e.g. VRS or NSGv; If VRS is defined, target_server_password must be defined in credentials.yml

vsd_license_file.title: VSD Standard License File
vsd_license_file.description: Path to the standard license file for the VSD including the file name

vsd_cluster_license_file.title: VSD Cluster License File
vsd_cluster_license_file.description: Path to the cluster license file for the VSD including the file name

vsd_license_required_days_left.title: VSD License Required Days Left
vsd_license_required_days_left.description: Raise a failure if the VSD licenses (Standard or cluster only) do not have at least the specified number of days remaining before expiration. If undefined, no check of days remaining before VSD license expiration will be made. If you want to verify that the number of days left before expiration is more than a certain number of days, uncomment this variable and set the value to the number of days.

vsd_continue_on_license_failure.title: Continue Metroae execution on VSD license failure
vsd_continue_on_license_failure.description: Continue Metroae execution even after license failure if this is set to true

vsd_ejabberd_license_file.title: VSD Ejabberd License File
vsd_ejabberd_license_file.description: Path to the Ejabberd license file for the VSD including the file name

portal_license_file.title: SD-WAN Portal License File
portal_license_file.description: Path to the license file for the SD-WAN Portal including the file name

nuh_license_file.title: NUH License File
nuh_license_file.description: Path to the license file for the NUH including the file name

yum_update.title: VSD yum update
yum_update.description: Flag to indicate whether to perform a Yum update on VSD during the installation

vstat_yum_update.title: VSTAT yum update
vstat_yum_update.description: Flag to indicate whether to perform a Yum update on VSTAT during the installation

yum_proxy.title: Proxy for Yum Updates
yum_proxy.description: Proxy URL to be used if Yum repositories cannot be directly reached

ssh_proxy_username.title: SSH proxy configuration username
ssh_proxy_username.description: Username of the SSH proxy host if one is used

ssh_proxy_host.title: SSH proxy configuration host
ssh_proxy_host.description: IP Address or Hostname of the SSH host if one is used

vsd_fallocate_size_gb.title: VSD Disk Size
vsd_fallocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VSD disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vsd_fallocate_size_gb.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsc_fallocate_size_gb.title: VSC Disk Size
vsc_fallocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VSC disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. The only valid values are 0 and 1. When undefined or 0, file size allocation will be skipped. Production deployments should set this value to 1.

vstat_allocate_size_gb.title: VSTAT Disk Size
vstat_allocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VSTAT disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments should not modify this value.

portal_allocate_size_gb.title: Portal Disk Size
portal_allocate_size_gb.description: Amount of Portal disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments should not modify this value.

vcin_allocate_size_gb.title: VCIN Disk Size
vcin_allocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VCIN disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments should not modify this value.

nsgv_allocate_size_gb.title: NSGV Disk Size
nsgv_allocate_size_gb.description: Amount of NSGV disk space to pre-allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments should not modify this value.

vsd_ram.title: KVM VSD RAM
vsd_ram.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Amount of VSD RAM to allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vsd_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsc_ram.title: KVM VSC RAM
vsc_ram.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Amount of VSC RAM to allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vsc_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vstat_ram.title: KVM VSTAT RAM
vstat_ram.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Amount of VSTAT RAM to allocate, in GB. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vstat_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vcin_ram.title: KVM VCIN RAM
vcin_ram.description: Amount of VCIN RAM to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vcin_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

nuh_ram.title: KVM NUH RAM
nuh_ram.description: Amount of NUH RAM to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
nuh_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

webfilter_ram.title: KVM Webfilter RAM
webfilter_ram.description: Amount of Webfilter RAM to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
webfilter_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

portal_ram.title: KVM Portal RAM
portal_ram.description: Amount of Portal RAM to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
portal_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsd_cpu_cores.title: KVM VSD CPU cores
vsd_cpu_cores.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Number of CPU's for VSD.

vsc_cpu_cores.title: KVM VSC CPU cores
vsc_cpu_cores.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Number of CPU's for VSC.

vstat_cpu_cores.title: KVM VSTAT CPU cores
vstat_cpu_cores.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Number of CPU's for VSTAT.

vnsutil_cpu_cores.title: KVM VNSUTIL CPU cores
vnsutil_cpu_cores.description: Valid for only KVM and VCenter deployments. Number of CPU's for VNSUTIL.

nuh_cpu_cores.title: KVM NUH CPU cores
nuh_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for NUH. Valid only for KVM deployments

vcin_cpu_cores.title: KVM VCIN CPU cores
vcin_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VCIN. Valid only for KVM deployments

portal_cpu_cores.title: KVM Portal VM CPU cores
portal_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for Portal vm. Valid only for KVM deployments

webfilter_cpu_cores.title: KVM Webfilter VM CPU cores
webfilter_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for Webfilter vm. Valid only for KVM deployments

vsd_auth_url.title: VSD Architect URL
vsd_auth_url.description: VSD Architect URL. Required for tasks during Upgrade, Health Checks etc

vsd_auth_enterprise.title: VSD Enterprise
vsd_auth_enterprise.description: Enterprise name used for authentication with VSD Architect. Required for tasks during Upgrade, Health Checks etc

vcin_auth_url.title: VCIN URL
vcin_auth_url.description: VCIN URL used for API interaction. Required for tasks like VRS-E upgrade (through VCIN)

vcin_auth_enterprise.title: VCIN Enterprise
vcin_auth_enterprise.description: Enterprise name used for authentication with VCIN. Required for tasks like VRS-E upgrade (through VCIN)

health_report_email_server.title: Health Report SMTP Server
health_report_email_server.description: Address of SMTP server to be used if emailing health results

health_report_email_server_port.title: Health Report SMTP Server Port
health_report_email_server_port.description: Port to be used on the SMTP Server

health_report_email_from_address.title: Health Report Email From Address
health_report_email_from_address.description: Email address from which health report will be sent

vsd_monit_mail_server.title: VSD Monit Mail Server
vsd_monit_mail_server.description: Address of the mail server to be used to receive monit alerts via email

vsd_monit_mail_server_port.title: VSD Monit Mail Server Port
vsd_monit_mail_server_port.description: Port on mail server to be used for monit alerts

vsd_monit_mail_server_encryption.title: VSD Monit Mail Server Encryption Type
vsd_monit_mail_server_encryption.description: Encryption to be used when sending monit alerts via email

vsd_use_monit_eventqueue.title: Use VSD Monit Eventqueue
vsd_use_monit_eventqueue.description: Enables use of monit eventqueue to store alerts if email alerts fail to send

vsd_monit_from_address.title: VSD Monit From Email Address
vsd_monit_from_address.description: Email address from which monit alerts will be sent

vsd_monit_reply_to_address.title: VSD Monit Reply-To Email Address
vsd_monit_reply_to_address.description: Email address to reply to monit alert emails

vsd_monit_email_subject.title: VSD Monit Email Alert Subject
vsd_monit_email_subject.description: Email subject for alert emails. Overrides monit default alert subject

vsd_monit_email_message.title: VSD Monit Email Alert Message
vsd_monit_email_message.description: Email message for alert emails. Overrides monit default alert message

vsd_monit_destination_address.title: VSD Monit Destination Email Address
vsd_monit_destination_address.description: Destination email address for monit alerts

vsd_monit_alert_only_on.title: VSD Monit Only Alert On
vsd_monit_alert_only_on.description: Specific events for which alerts should be sent. One string can be used to hold multiple events, separated by commas

vsd_monit_alert_not_on.title: VSD Monit Do Not Alert On
vsd_monit_alert_not_on.description: Events for which alerts should not be sent. One string can be used to hold multiple events, separated by commas

vsd_install_inplace_upgrade.title: VSD In-place upgrade during Install
vsd_install_inplace_upgrade.description: Allowing VSD in-place upgrade during Installation

keep_root_access.title: Keep root access
keep_root_access.description: Create custom username and password without hardening
